assesment_method: Structured interviews, case study analysis, psychometric tests like Watson-Glaser

experience_project: Leading a root cause analysis project for a manufacturing defect, developing a business case for a new market entry
legal_compliance_relevance: Critical thinking is essential for compliance roles to interpret regulations accurately and avoid le
performance_metrics: Accuracy of conclusions, effectiveness of proposed solutions, time taken to analyze complex information
common_errors_tips: Jumping to conclusions without evidence, confirmation bias, over-reliance on gut feeling

Design and develop carbon credit projects that effectively reduce, remove, avoid and store greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions, in compliance with applicable carbon crediting standards, for the eventual issuance for carbon credits for future trading by the organisation.

It also includes demonstrating awareness, sensitivity and respect to diversity in children?s cultural, language, and religious backgrounds.

title: Support Children's Development of Secure Attachments through Warm, Consistent and Nurturing Care-giving (Educarer 1)
description: The skill describes the ability to support children?s development of secure attachment by responding promptly and appropriately to children?s needs, displaying warm and nurturing care-giving, maintaining continuity of care and managing separation anxiety. It also includes the maintaining of regular routines which cater to children?s moods and interests, the understanding of attachment patterns of each child and the strategies to provide predictability for young children.

title: Demand Analysis
description: Devise frameworks to assess market dynamics and execute analyses to uncover demand outlook of products or services
assesment_method: Written tests, Case study analysis, Project evaluation
certification_qualifications: Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP), PMI Professional in Business Analysis (PMI-PBA)
experience_project: Conducting market analysis for a new product launch in the Indian market
legal_compliance_relevance: Demand analysis must comply with the Competition Act, 2002 to avoid anti-competitive practices and e
performance_metrics: Accuracy of forecasts, Market share analysis, ROI on analysis
common_errors_tips: Inaccurate data sources, Ignoring regional market variations, Overlooking competitor strategies
sme_contacts: Market Research Analyst, Business Analyst, Product Manager
sub_skills: Data Collection, Statistical Analysis, Trend Identification, Report Generation
skill_flow: 1. Define the objective and scope of the analysis. 2. Identify and gather relevant market data. 3. Clean and process the collected data. 4. Analyze trends and patterns using statistical tools
tasklist: Collect market data, Analyze consumer trends, Generate demand reports, Present findings

title: Business Agility
description: Organise the business, work activities and people in ways that enable the organisation to readily adapt to changes in its internal or external environment, whilst achieving desired outcomes and delivering value to customers
certification_qualifications: SAFe Agilist, Certified ScrumMaster (CSM), PMI Agile Certified Practitioner (PMI-ACP)
experience_project: Leading an agile transformation initiative in an Indian IT services company
legal_compliance_relevance: Business agility practices should align with Indian corporate governance standards and the Companies
performance_metrics: Team velocity, Adaptability index, Project delivery time
common_errors_tips: Resistance to change, Lack of executive sponsorship, Inadequate training
sme_contacts: Agile Coach, Change Management Consultant, HR Business Partner
sub_skills: Lean Management, Scrum, Kanban, Continuous Improvement
skill_flow: 1. Assess current organizational processes and culture. 2. Develop a tailored agility roadmap. 3. Train teams and leaders on agile principles. 4. Implement agile frameworks incrementally. 5.
tasklist: Facilitate agile workshops, Implement new processes, Monitor team performance, Review outcomes

title: Business Continuity
description: Develop internal infrastructure to ensure organisational resilience and maintenance of the availability, stability and integrity of critical systems, processes and stakeholders that support and drive key aspects of the business. This includes the planning, designing and testing contingency plans and setting up of internal systems and structures which are ready to respond to potential threats and maintain desired levels of continuity.
assesment_method: Audits, Tabletop exercises, BCP plan reviews
certification_qualifications: Certified Business Continuity Professional (CBCP), ISO 22301 Lead Implementer
experience_project: Developing a business continuity plan for a financial institution in India
legal_compliance_relevance: Business continuity planning is critical for compliance with RBI guidelines for banks and NBFCs in I
performance_metrics: Recovery Time Objective (RTO), Recovery Point Objective (RPO), Test success rate
common_errors_tips: Incomplete risk assessment, Lack of regular testing, Poor communication plans
sme_contacts: BCP Manager, Risk Officer, IT Disaster Recovery Specialist
sub_skills: Risk Assessment, Plan Development, Testing and Exercises, Plan Maintenance
skill_flow: 1. Conduct a business impact analysis (BIA). 2. Identify critical functions and recovery priorities. 3. Develop recovery strategies and plans. 4. Train employees and conduct drills. 5. Regula
tasklist: Perform risk assessment, Write BCP documents, Conduct training sessions, Execute test drills

title: Disaster Recovery Management
description: Develop and implement internal policies, processes and arrangements to guide and enable the prompt recovery of critical IT infrastructure and systems following a crisis or disaster. This includes monitoring the efficiency and effectiveness of response to significant incidents or disruptions and reviewing the organisation's disaster recovery plan and processes.
assesment_method: DR drill simulations, Plan documentation review, Audit
certification_qualifications: Certified Disaster Recovery Engineer (CDRE), ISO 27031 Lead Implementer
experience_project: Implementing a disaster recovery solution for an e-commerce platform in India
legal_compliance_relevance: Disaster recovery is mandated for IT companies under the IT Act, 2000 and related cybersecurity guid
performance_metrics: Recovery time, Data loss metrics, Test frequency
common_errors_tips: Inadequate backup systems, Unrealistic RTO/RPO, Lack of automation
sme_contacts: DR Specialist, Cloud Architect, Network Administrator
sub_skills: Backup Management, Failover Procedures, Recovery Testing, Documentation
skill_flow: 1. Define recovery objectives (RTO, RPO). 2. Design and implement backup solutions. 3. Develop detailed recovery procedures. 4. Conduct regular recovery drills. 5. Update plans based on drill
tasklist: Configure backup systems, Document recovery steps, Perform recovery tests, Update DR plans

title: Portfolio Management
description: Manage systematically the IT investments, projects, services and activities within a company, in line with business objectives and priorities. This involves the development of a framework to evaluate potential costs and benefits and make key decisions about IT investments, internal allocation and utilisation of IT resources and/or assets and any changes to IT processes or services offered
assesment_method: Portfolio review meetings, ROI analysis, Business case evaluation
certification_qualifications: PfMP (Portfolio Management Professional), MoP (Management of Portfolios)
experience_project: Managing a portfolio of IT projects for a large Indian conglomerate
legal_compliance_relevance: Portfolio management must ensure compliance with SEBI regulations for publicly listed companies in I
performance_metrics: Return on Investment (ROI), Strategic alignment, Resource utilization
common_errors_tips: Poor alignment with business goals, Inadequate risk assessment, Lack of stakeholder engagement
sme_contacts: Portfolio Manager, Chief Investment Officer, Strategy Head
sub_skills: Financial Analysis, Risk Management, Stakeholder Communication, Performance Monitoring
skill_flow: 1. Define portfolio objectives and alignment with business strategy. 2. Evaluate and select projects based on criteria. 3. Allocate resources and budget. 4. Monitor portfolio performance and
tasklist: Analyze project proposals, Allocate budgets, Monitor project performance, Report to stakeholders

title: Agile Coaching

assesment_method: Team feedback, Coaching session observations, Agile maturity assessments
certification_qualifications: Certified Team Coach (CTC), ICAgile Certified Professional (ICP-ACC)
experience_project: Coaching multiple teams in an Indian software company to adopt Scrum
legal_compliance_relevance: Agile coaching should promote practices that comply with data privacy norms during agile project exe
performance_metrics: Team sprint velocity, Retrospective effectiveness, Adoption rate
common_errors_tips: Imposing agile rather than coaching, Ignoring team context, Lack of management support
sme_contacts: Agile Coach, Scrum Master, Transformation Lead
skill_flow: 1. Assess the current agile maturity of the team. 2. Develop a personalized coaching plan. 3. Conduct workshops and training sessions. 4. Facilitate agile ceremonies effectively. 5. Provide c
tasklist: Conduct agile assessments, Facilitate ceremonies, Provide one-on-one coaching, Measure improvement

title: Narrative Design in Product Development
description: Develop the flow of the content through designing narrative elements within product development and at the product launch stages to create an engaging audience experience
assesment_method: Portfolio review, User testing, Narrative flow assessment
certification_qualifications: No specific major certification, relevant UX/Content certifications
experience_project: Designing the user onboarding storyflow for a fintech app in India
legal_compliance_relevance: Narrative design must ensure content is not misleading and complies with advertising standards in In
performance_metrics: User engagement metrics, Completion rates, User feedback
common_errors_tips: Inconsistent tone, Overly complex narratives, Ignoring cultural nuances
sme_contacts: UX Writer, Content Strategist, Product Designer
sub_skills: Copywriting, User Journey Mapping, Prototyping, Usability Testing
skill_flow: 1. Understand the product and target audience. 2. Define the core narrative and key messages. 3. Map the narrative to the user journey. 4. Write and integrate content into the UI. 5. Test and
tasklist: Write user stories, Create journey maps, Design wireframes, Conduct user tests

title: Data Design
description: Specify and create a data structure or database model, including the setting of various parameters or fields that can be modified to suit different structured or unstructured data requirements, the design of data flow, as well as the development of mechanisms for maintenance, storage and retrieval of data based on the business requirements
assesment_method: Design reviews, Data modeling tests, Project evaluation
certification_qualifications: CDMP (Certified Data Management Professional), Oracle Database SQL Certified Associate
experience_project: Designing the database schema for a government health portal in India
legal_compliance_relevance: Data design must adhere to data structuring norms outlined in the Personal Data Protection Bill, 201
common_errors_tips: Poor normalization, Ignoring future scalability, Inadequate indexing
sme_contacts: Data Architect, Database Administrator, Solutions Architect
sub_skills: Conceptual Modeling, Logical Modeling, Physical Modeling, Normalization
skill_flow: 1. Gather and analyze business requirements. 2. Create conceptual and logical data models. 3. Design the physical database schema. 4. Define constraints, indexes, and relationships. 5. Review
tasklist: Gather requirements, Create ER diagrams, Define tables and relationships, Optimize schema

title: Security Architecture
description: Design security architectures and controls; either embedding of security principles into the design of architectures to mitigate the risks posed by new technologies and business practices, or the actual design and specification of implementable security components, along with the accompanying control measures, to meet defined business security needs
assesment_method: Architecture review, Penetration testing, Compliance audit
certification_qualifications: CISSP (Certified Information Systems Security Professional), SABSA (Sherwood Applied Business Security Architecture)
experience_project: Designing the security architecture for a national payments system in India
legal_compliance_relevance: Security architecture must comply with RBIs cybersecurity framework for banks and payment systems.
performance_metrics: Number of vulnerabilities detected, Compliance score, Incident response time
common_errors_tips: Over-engineering security, Ignoring usability, Lack of defense in depth
sme_contacts: Security Architect, Cybersecurity Lead, Risk Analyst
sub_skills: Threat Modeling, Control Selection, Architecture Documentation, Security Testing
skill_flow: 1. Define security requirements and objectives. 2. Identify and model potential threats. 3. Select and design appropriate security controls. 4. Document the security architecture. 5. Validate
tasklist: Conduct threat modeling, Select security controls, Create architecture diagrams, Validate design

title: Software Design
description: Create and refine the overall plan for the design of software, including the design of functional specifications starting from the defined business requirements as well as the consideration and incorporation of various controls, functionality and interoperability of different elements into a design blueprint or model which describes the overall architecture in hardware, software, databases, and third party frameworks that the software will use or interact with
assesment_method: Design document review, Code review, System modeling tests
certification_qualifications: AWS Certified Solutions Architect, TOGAF Certified
experience_project: Creating the software design for a scalable e-commerce platform in India
legal_compliance_relevance: Software design should consider accessibility guidelines as per the Rights of Persons with Disabilit
common_errors_tips: Tight coupling of components, Ignoring non-functional requirements, Insufficient documentation
sme_contacts: Software Architect, Lead Developer, System Analyst
sub_skills: Requirement Analysis, High-Level Design, Detailed Design, Design Review
skill_flow: 1. Analyze software requirements. 2. Define the high-level system architecture. 3. Create detailed design documents using UML. 4. Apply appropriate design patterns. 5. Review the design with
tasklist: Analyze requirements, Create architecture diagrams, Write design documents, Conduct reviews

title: User Interface Design
description: Design user interfaces for machines and software, incorporating visual, technical and functional elements that facilitate ease of access, understanding and usage. This would involve adding, removing, modifying or enhancing elements to make the user's interaction with the product as seamless as possible
assesment_method: Portfolio assessment, Usability testing, Design critique
certification_qualifications: Google UX Design Professional Certificate, Nielsen Norman Group UX Certification
experience_project: Designing the UI for a mobile banking application tailored for Indian users
legal_compliance_relevance: UI design must ensure accessibility compliance as per WCAG guidelines, referenced in Indian IT acces
performance_metrics: User task success rate, Time on task, User satisfaction scores
common_errors_tips: Cluttered interfaces, Inconsistent styling, Ignoring user feedback
sme_contacts: UI Designer, UX Designer, Product Designer
sub_skills: Wireframing, Visual Design, Prototyping, Usability Testing
skill_flow: 1. Research user needs and behaviors. 2. Create wireframes and mockups. 3. Develop interactive prototypes. 4. Conduct usability tests. 5. Iterate on the design based on feedback.
tasklist: Create user personas, Design wireframes, Build prototypes, Conduct user testing

title: Embedded Systems Interface Design
description: Design and set up interface and interconnections from or among sensors, through a network, to a main location, to enable transmission of information
assesment_method: Circuit design review, Code review for drivers, Integration testing
certification_qualifications: No specific major certification, often part of engineering degrees
experience_project: Designing the sensor interface for an IoT-based smart agriculture system in India
legal_compliance_relevance: Embedded designs must comply with BIS (Bureau of Indian Standards) for electronic equipment safety.
performance_metrics: Data transmission accuracy, Power consumption, Reliability
common_errors_tips: Signal interference, Poor error handling, Hardware-software mismatch
sme_contacts: Embedded Systems Engineer, Hardware Design Engineer, IoT Specialist
sub_skills: Circuit Design, Driver Development, Protocol Implementation, Integration Testing

tasklist: Design circuit schematics, Write driver code, Test sensor communication, Integrate with network

title: Solution Architecture
description: Design or refine a solution blueprint or structure to guide the development of IT solutions in hardware, software, processes or related components, to meet current and future business needs. title: Business Agility
description: Organise the business, work activities and people in ways that enable the organisation to readily adapt to changes in its internal or external environment, whilst achieving desired outcomes and delivering value to customers

title: Business Continuity
description: Develop internal infrastructure to ensure organisational resilience and maintenance of the availability, stability and integrity of critical systems, processes and stakeholders that support and drive key aspects of the business. This includes the planning, designing and testing contingency plans and setting up of internal systems and structures which are ready to respond to potential threats and maintain desired levels of continuity.

title: Disaster Recovery Management
description: Develop and implement internal policies, processes and arrangements to guide and enable the prompt recovery of critical IT infrastructure and systems following a crisis or disaster. This includes monitoring the efficiency and effectiveness of response to significant incidents or disruptions and reviewing the organisation's disaster recovery plan and processes.

title: Portfolio Management
description: Manage systematically the IT investments, projects, services and activities within a company, in line with business objectives and priorities. This involves the development of a framework to evaluate potential costs and benefits and make key decisions about IT investments, internal allocation and utilisation of IT resources and/or assets and any changes to IT processes or services offered

title: Agile Coaching
description: Formulate and implement Agile coaching frameworks, processes and standards to foster Agile mindset and practices within the organisation and develop Agile teams

title: Narrative Design in Product Development
description: Develop the flow of the content through designing narrative elements within product development and at the product launch stages to create an engaging audience experience

title: Data Design
description: Specify and create a data structure or database model, including the setting of various parameters or fields that can be modified to suit different structured or unstructured data requirements, the design of data flow, as well as the development of mechanisms for maintenance, storage and retrieval of data based on the business requirements

title: Security Architecture
description: Design security architectures and controls; either embedding of security principles into the design of architectures to mitigate the risks posed by new technologies and business practices, or the actual design and specification of implementable security components, along with the accompanying control measures, to meet defined business security needs

title: Software Design
description: Create and refine the overall plan for the design of software, including the design of functional specifications starting from the defined business requirements as well as the consideration and incorporation of various controls, functionality and interoperability of different elements into a design blueprint or model which describes the overall architecture in hardware, software, databases, and third party frameworks that the software will use or interact with

title: User Interface Design
description: Design user interfaces for machines and software, incorporating visual, technical and functional elements that facilitate ease of access, understanding and usage. This would involve adding, removing, modifying or enhancing elements to make the user's interaction with the product as seamless as possible

title: Solution Architecture
description: Design or refine a solution blueprint or structure to guide the development of IT solutions in hardware, software, processes or related components, to meet current and future business needs. The solution architecture developed may lead to broad or specific changes to IT services, operating models and processes, and should provide a framework to guide the development and modification of solutions

title: Enterprise Architecture
description: Operationalise a business strategy on the planning and development of business structures and models to facilitate the evolution of a business to its desired future state. This involves the review and prioritisation of market trends, evaluation of alternative strategies, as well as the strategic evaluation and utilisation of enterprise capability and technology to support business requirements

title: Systems Design
description: Design systems to meet specified business and user requirements that are compatible with established system architectures, as well as organisational and performance standards

title: Intelligent Reasoning
description: Design and build intelligent machine reasoning systems that can integrate, make sense of, and act upon heterogeneous sensory information sources, using domain knowledge accumulated in respective industries

title: Configuration Tracking
description: Track systematically and manage changes and revisions in software projects to ensure that all changes are accounted for and to protect assets against unauthorized change, diversion and inappropriate use

title: Data Engineering
description: Develop and implement efficient and stable processes to collect, store, extract, transform, load and integrate data at various stages in the data pipeline. This also involves processing varying amounts of data from a variety of sources and preparing data in a structure that is easily access and analysed according to business requirements

title: Security Assessment and Testing
description: Conduct threat modelling, vulnerability assessment and penetration testing to reveal vulnerabilities or lapses in the existing systems or security mechanisms and evaluate the extent to which systems are able to protect the organisation's data and maintain functionality as intended

title: Software Testing
description: Assess and test the overall effectiveness and performance of an application, involving the setting up of suitable testing conditions, definition of test cases and/or technical criteria

title: Computational Modelling
description: Develop, select and apply algorithms and advanced computational methods to enable systems or software agents to learn, improve, adapt and produce desired outcomes or tasks. This also involves the interpretation of data, including the application of data modelling techniques to explore and address a specific issues or requirements

title: Applications Development
description: Develop applications based on the design specifications; encompassing coding, testing, debugging, documenting and reviewing and/or refining it across the application development stages in accordance with defined standards for development and security. The complexity of the application may range from a basic application to a context-aware and/or augmented reality application that incorporates predictive behaviour analytics, geo-spatial capabilities and other appropriate algorithms. The technical skill includes the analysis and possibly the reuse, improvement, reconfiguration, addition or integration of existing and/or new application components.

title: Data Visualisation
description: Implement contemporary techniques, dynamic visual displays with illustrative and interactive graphics to present patterns, trends, analytical insights from data or new concepts in a strategic manner for the intended audience

title: Quality Engineering
description: Create, deploy and maintain quality-related systems, processes and tools to establish an environment that supports process and product quality

title: Security Programme Management
description: Develop and manage security solutions, products and services through technology innovation, experimentation and collaboration. This includes security programme planning, developing and testing new security capabilities and implementing security technologies and programmes

title: System Integration
description: Develop and implement a roadmap and specific integration solutions to facilitate integration of various ICT components and optimise inter-operability of systems and their interfaces. This includes the integration of various architectural components such as networks, servers, system platforms and their interfaces

title: Agile Software Development
description: Plan and implement Agile methodology and the use of adaptive and iterative methods and techniques in the software development lifecycle to account for continuous evolution, development, and deployment to enable seamless delivery of the application to the end user

title: Cloud Computing
description: Implement cloud solutions to enhance business performance and security of IT systems

description: Manage the planning, building, testing and integration of codes, and deployment of software changes and updates into a live environment

title: Network Security
description: Design and configure network systems to ensure the integrity of network infrastructure through the use of appropriate protection, detection and response mechanisms

title: Radio Frequency Engineering

title: Data Visualisation and Storyboarding
description: Implement contemporary techniques, dynamic visual displays with illustrative and interactive graphics to present patterns, trends, analytical insights from data or new concepts in a strategic manner for the intended audience

description: Develop and deploy vision analytics algorithm and spatial sensing and/or reasoning systems

title: Network Slicing

description: Develop and apply intelligent pattern recognition systems and techniques to analyse data and derive useful hidden patterns to solve problems

title: Text Analytics and Processing

description: Develop and implement a Data Protection Management Programme to comply with the Personal Data Protection Act 2012

title: Data Sharing
description: Assess the value of data to achieve a competitive advantage and business objectives

title: Data Ethics
description: Apply legal and ethical principles in the collection, use, storage and disposal of data

title: Audit and Compliance
description: Develop compliance processes and audit strategy for the organisation to review adherence to statutory regulatory and standards. Assessment and enhancement of the thoroughness of compliance and/or governance processes and organisation's internal controls to align with changing compliance standards. This also includes the actual conduct and/or performance of audit activities

title: IT Governance
description: Set and monitor IT infrastructure, information, digital services and associated technology. This involves developing policies and practices to govern the organisation's approach toward handling and using IT products and services in order to ensure conformance with regulations and accountability in decision making in alignment with the business strategic plans and service standards

title: IT Standards
description: Develop and review of standard operating procedures as well as service expectations for IT-related activities and processes. This includes the provision of clear guidelines for the organisation to carry out IT-related tasks in a manner that is effective, efficient and consistent with the IT service standards and quality standards of the organisation

title: Applications Support and Enhancement
description: Provide ongoing technical support and improvements to users of applications. This includes technical guidance and assistance related to the installation and maintenance of applications, fixing and resolution of application problems or disruptions, and response to change requests that will enhance the operations and usage of an application

title: Network Administration and Maintenance
description: Monitor network in order to provide for optimum levels of network performance and minimisation of downtime. This includes detection, isolation, recovery and limitation of the impact of failures on the network as well as provision of support to system users through ongoing maintenance information sharing and training

title: Cyber Forensics
description: Develop and manage digital forensic investigation and reporting plan which specifies the tools, methods, procedures and practices to be used. This includes the collection, analysis and preservation of digital evidence in line with standard procedures and reporting of findings for legal proceedings

title: Cyber and Data Breach Incident Management
description: Detect and report cyber and data-related incidents, identify affected systems and user groups, trigger alerts and announcements to relevant stakeholders and efficient resolution of the situation.

description: Manage and maintain data centre resources, facilities and/or physical infrastructure to ensure smooth, stable and sustainable operations within data centres. This includes monitoring and managing energy supply requirements, availability and consumption, ensuring the necessary resources are in place to support a stable power supply and day-to-day management of data centre equipment. This involves the management of the physical environment / conditions within the data centre and implementation of security measures to safeguard the integrity of the data centre

title: Database Administration
description: Perform Installation, coordination and upgrading of databases and database servers, performance monitoring and troubleshooting. This includes monitoring user access to database and optimisation of database performance, planning for backup and recovery, archived data maintenance and reporting

title: IT Asset Management
description: Manage, optimise and protect the organisation's IT assets. This includes the timely purchase, deployment, categorisation, maintenance and phase out of IT assets within the organisation in a way that optimises business value. Also includes development and implementation of procedures to guide the proper handling, usage and storage of IT assets to limit potential business or legal risks

title: Security Administration
description: Administer, configure and update of security programmes and mechanisms, including the application of system patches to ensure that enterprise assets are adequately protected against threats. This also includes the authorisation, management and monitoring of access control permissions and/or rights to various IT facilities

title: Threat Intelligence and Detection
description: Monitor intelligence-gathering and anticipate potential threats to an ICT system proactively. This involves the pre-emptive analysis of potential perpetrators, anomalous activities and evidence-based knowledge and inferences on perpetrators' motivations and tactics

title: Data Migration
description: Plan and perform activities to migrate data between computer storage types or file formats

title: Problem Management
description: Manage the lifecycle of problems to prevent problems and incidents from occurring, eliminate recurring incidents and minimise impact of unavoidable incidents

title: Security Education and Awareness
description: Drive security education and awareness in an organisation by providing advice and guidance on potential risks, mitigation strategies and best practices. This includes development of communication strategies and training materials to ensure employee adoption and adherence to security policies and standards

title: Threat Analysis and Defence
description: Enable and conduct analysis of malicious threats, to examine their characteristics, behaviours, capabilities, intent and interactions with the environment as well as the development of defence and mitigation strategies and techniques to effectively combat such threats

It also includes the setting of information storage, sharing, handling and usage protocols to support alignment with relevant legislation and business strategies

This involves the planning, implementation and review of enterprise-wide security controls which includes policies, processes, physical infrastructure, software and hardware functions to govern and preserve the privacy, security and confidentiality of the organisation's information and assets

description: Measure and assess the risks due to hazardous substances at the workplace

description: Manage the operational issues associated with the control and put in place appropriate risk control measures in the construction industry

title: Reading Comprehension
description: Understanding written sentences and paragraphs in work-related documents.

title: Active Listening
description: Giving full attention to what other people are saying, taking time to understand the points being made, asking questions as appropriate, and not interrupting at inappropriate times.

title: Writing
description: Communicating effectively in writing as appropriate for the needs of the audience.

title: Speaking
description: Talking to others to convey information effectively.

title: Mathematics
description: Using mathematics to solve problems.

title: Science
description: Using scientific rules and methods to solve problems.

title: Critical Thinking
description: Using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions, or approaches to problems.

title: Active Learning
description: Understanding the implications of new information for both current and future problem-solving and decision-making.

title: Learning Strategies
description: Selecting and using training/instructional methods and procedures appropriate for the situation when learning or teaching new things.

title: Monitoring
description: Monitoring/Assessing performance of yourself, other individuals, or organizations to make improvements or take corrective action.

title: Social Perceptiveness
description: Being aware of others' reactions and understanding why they react as they do.

title: Coordination
description: Adjusting actions in relation to others' actions.

title: Persuasion
description: Persuading others to change their minds or behavior.

title: Negotiation
description: Bringing others together and trying to reconcile differences.

title: Instructing
description: Teaching others how to do something.

title: Service Orientation
description: Actively looking for ways to help people.

title: Complex Problem Solving
description: Identifying complex problems and reviewing related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions.

title: Operations Analysis
description: Analyzing needs and product requirements to create a design.

title: Operations Monitoring
description: Watching gauges, dials, or other indicators to make sure a machine is working properly.

title: Operation and Control
description: Controlling operations of equipment or systems.

title: Troubleshooting
description: Determining causes of operating errors and deciding what to do about it.

title: Quality Control Analysis
description: Conducting tests and inspections of products, services, or processes to evaluate quality or performance.

title: Judgment and Decision Making
description: Considering the relative costs and benefits of potential actions to choose the most appropriate one.

title: Systems Analysis
description: Determining how a system should work and how changes in conditions, operations, and the environment will affect outcomes.

title: Systems Evaluation
description: Identifying measures or indicators of system performance and the actions needed to improve or correct performance, relative to the goals of the system.

title: Time Management
description: Managing one's own time and the time of others.

title: Management of Financial Resources
description: Determining how money will be spent to get the work done, and accounting for these expenditures.

title: Management of Material Resources
description: Obtaining and seeing to the appropriate use of equipment, facilities, and materials needed to do certain work.

title: Management of Personnel Resources
description: Motivating, developing, and directing people as they work, identifying the best people for the job.
